main event: A round object was observed slowly moving west and disappearing over the horizon in Council Bluffs, Iowa in November 1957.
interesting points: The object was observed for 2 hours and 20 minutes.
The source of the sighting was a civilian observer.
An astro pilot determined that the observed object was likely the planet Venus in the same location at the time reported.
The object was described as a round object.
The object was slowly moving west before disappearing over the horizon.
